result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Brogli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 11:03am
INCLUDES 14CF220, 14CF605, 16CM1516, 16CM1562
State appears by ADA Ray Pelrine; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Wright Laufenberg
Date and time set for SAR in 14CF220 & 14CF605 & pleas in 16CM1516 & 16CM1562

SAR's in 14CF220 & 14CF605
Parties state recommendation for sentencing.
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 14CF220 Ct. 2 (possession of THC (2nd+ offense)-repeater): 3 and half years WSPS- 2 years IC, 1 and half years ES, consecutive to 14CF605 Ct. 1. Credit granted of 182 days.
COURT ORDERS: 14CF220 Ct. 3 (possess drug paraphernalia- repeater)- 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES, concurrent to Ct. 2 in 14CF220. Credit granted of 272 days. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF605 Ct. 1 (possession of methamphetamine-repeater) - 3 and half years WSPS- 2 years IC, 1 and half years ES, consecutive to 14CF220 Ct. 2. Credit granted of 277 days. 
CONDITIONS of ES on all counts: Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and provide surcharge. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. Subject to random UA's to ensure sobriety compliance. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Challenge Incarceration & Substance Abuse. 

Plea's in 16CM1516 & 16CM1562:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
16CM1516:
Ct. 2. Theft-Movable property <=$2500- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Theft-Movable property <=$2500- repeater >> D&RI
16CM1562:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
16CM1516:
Ct. 1 Criminal Damage to property- repeater >> GUILTY
Ct. 3 Criminal Damage to property- repeater >> GUILTY
Ct. 5 Theft-Movable property <=$2500- repeater >> GUILTY
16CM1562:
Ct. 1 Retail theft- intentionally take (<=$500)- repeater >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1516 Ct. 1, Ct. 3, Ct. 5 & 16CM1562 Ct. 1: w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation on each count. Probation to run consecutive to prison sentences (14CF220 Ct. 2 & Ct. 3 and 14CF650 Ct. 1) but concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week. Write letter of apology to victims in 16CM1516- H.S., E.P., M.P. Pay back restitution to M.P. of $87.00. Pay back restitution in 16CM1562 to Sam's Club in Rib Mtn. of $168.88. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Zero days credit if revoked. 

Deft remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Prison.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:50 a.m. 
**Includes 14CF220 & 14CF605**
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Def appears in person with Atty Wright Laufenberg. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.  
State moves to:14CF220- DRI Ct.1> Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater) & DRI Ct.4> Possession of Controlled Substance
                          14CF605- DRI Ct.2> Bail Jumping (Felony) & DRI Ct.3> Possess Drug Para. (Repeater) 
PLEA: 14CF220-Ct.2> Possession of THC (2nd offense)(Repeater)>> NO CONTEST 
                            Ct.3> Possess Drug Para. (Repeater)>> NO CONTEST 
           14CF605- Ct.1> Possession of Methamphetamine (Repeater)>> NO CONTEST                          
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty in 14CF220 on Ct.2 & Ct.3 & guilty in 14CF605 on Ct.1. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH in 14CF220 Ct.2 and 14CF605 Ct.1-2 years probation, SWH on 14CF220 Ct. 3- 1 year probation concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: Ct.2 180 days MCJ I/S for rule violations, All counts: assessment, treatment & counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE to obtain and maintain FTE, schooling or a combination of both, no contact with co-defendants; C.S. & A.A., AODA, absolute sobriety, DNA sample & DNA surcharge, CC.
Jail credit to be addressed in the future if revoked. 
Voter ineligibility notice and acknowledgment signed and filed. 
Bond to be returned to poster.
